member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.ProtectVideoFileAction.#ctor(Genetec.Synergis.Routables.Actions.ProtectFileAction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.ProtectLiveVideoAction
member.summary: Represents an action used to add video protection on the live video.
member.remarks: Target Entity: Camera Use this action to protect any video archived in the next ApplyProtectionTime for ProtectionLength from deletion. The minimum ApplyProtectionTime is 5 minutes and the minimum ProtectionLength is 1 day. Protection begins immediately and continues for the specified ApplyProtectionTime. The video will remain protected for the specified ProtectionLength. Note that only recorded video will be protected and this method does not trigger recording.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.ProtectLiveVideoAction.Camera
member.summary: Gets the camera's unique identifier.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.ProtectLiveVideoAction.ProtectionEndTime
member.summary: Gets the date and time when the protection for any videos archived during this protection will end.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.ProtectLiveVideoAction.ApplyProtectionTime
member.summary: Gets or sets how long protection is enabled for. Any video archived within this time will be protected for the ApplyProtectionTime duration.
member.value: The apply protection time. TimeSpan.MaxValue to protect the video for an infinite time.
member.exception: The protection time must be larger than zero.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.ProtectLiveVideoAction.ProtectionLength
member.summary: Gets or sets how long the archived video is protected for.
member.value: The length of the protection. TimeSpan.MaxValue to protect the video for an infinite time.
member.exception: The protection length must be larger than zero.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.StopProtectLiveVideoAction
member.summary: Represents an action used to stop video protection on the live video.
member.remarks:
Target Entity: Camera
Use this method to stop the process of live video protection following a call to . Protection will stop after the specified StopApplyingProtectionLength has elapsed. To stop ongoing protection immediately specify a delay of TimeSpan.Zero. This method does not remove protection from archived video.

member.summary: The internal action

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Actions.Video.StopProtectLiveVideoAction.StopApplyingProtectionLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time until disabling video protection.
member.value: The length of the stop applying protection. TimeSpan.Zero to stop video protection immediately.
member.exception: The stop protection length must be larger than zero.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we use application credentials.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo
member.summary: ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.CreateUserOnFirstLogon
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we create the user on first logon.
member.value: true if create user on first logon; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property represents the "Create User on First Logon" setting in the active directory.
When false, it means that it will not import/synchronize all the Users from the active directory.
When false, it means that the users will only be "Created On First Logon".
When true, it means that the users will all be imported/synchronized.
When true, all the users will be created in the system, even those that never logged on.
This property will not be effective unless the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.GroupAccountGuid
member.summary: Gets the group account GUID.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.GroupAccountName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the group account.
member.value: The name of the group account.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.SynchronizeCardholders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we synchronize cardholders.
member.value: true if synchronize cardholders; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property represents importing the Active Directory groups As Cardholder groups.
Also represents importing Active Directory Users as Cardholders.
When true, the active directory will push/synchronize its groups and users into the system as Cardholders.
When false, the Groups/Users from the active directory will not be imported as Cardholder Groups/Users.
When setting this to false, it will automatically set property to false.
This property will be set to true automatically when the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.SynchronizeCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we synchronize credentials.
member.value: true if synchronize credentials; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property will let you import credentials from the Active Directory.
When true, it will import/synchronize the Active Directory's Users Credentials.
When true, an Active Directory User who changes his password on Windows will also take effect in the system.
The username shall be either domain.com\user or user@domain.com to login to the system.
When false, it will not synchronize the Active Directory's user credentials.
Setting this property to true will automatically set the property to true.
When the property is set to false, this property will automatically be set to false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.SynchronizeUserGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether synchronize user group.
member.value: true if synchronize user group; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ActiveDirectory.ImportedActiveDirectoryGroupInfo.#ctor(System.Guid,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true synchronize cardholders.
if set to true synchronize credentials.
if set to true synchronize user group.
if set to true synchronize users.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.OrdinalCoverage
member.summary: Class that represents an ordinal coverage that supports ordinal and twilight items.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.OrdinalCoverage.CoverageItems
member.summary: Gets the coverage items.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.OrdinalCoverage.Add(Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.OrdinalCoverageByDayOfMonthItem)
member.summary: Adds the to the current instance.
member.exception: Expected item should be a non-null instance of OrdinalCoverageByDayOfMonthItem.
member.remarks: This adds a whole to the OrdinalCoverage. To add or remove a to this coverage, you need to get the corresponding coverage item, get the coverage of the item and use add/remove in that coverage and re-add it to the specific coverage. For example, if you have an item for Day 15 of every month that covers 12:00pm - 1:00 and you want to add another one the same day from 2:00pm - 3:00pm. You need to get this item, get the coverage property and use coverage.Add(CoverageDayOffset, DailyCoverageItem) to add the 2-3pm range and use ordinalCoverage.Add(OrdinalCoverageByDayOfMonthItem) to add it to the OrdinalCoverage, and lastly set it to the Schedule via Schedule.Coverage.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.OrdinalCoverage.Add(Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.OrdinalCoverageByDayOfWeekItem)
member.summary: Adds the to the current instance.
member.exception: Expected item should be a non-null instance of OrdinalCoverageByDayOfWeekItem.
member.remarks: This adds a whole to the OrdinalCoverage. To add or remove a to this coverage, you need to get the corresponding coverage item, get the coverage of the item and use add/remove in that coverage and re-add it to the specific coverage. For example, if you have an item for Day 15 of every month that covers 12:00pm - 1:00 and you want to add another one the same day from 2:00pm - 3:00pm. You need to get this item, get the coverage property and use coverage.Add(CoverageDayOffset, DailyCoverageItem) to add the 2-3pm range and use ordinalCoverage.Add(OrdinalCoverageByDayOfWeekItem) to add it to the OrdinalCoverage, and lastly set it to the Schedule via Schedule.Coverage.

member.summary: Represents the day of the month.
member.remarks: If the specified value is more than the days of the specified month, it will set it to the maximum number of days that month can have. For example, if January then the value will be 31, if April then the value will be 30. For February, it will be 29 but it does not make any calculation about leap years.

member.summary: Gets the coverage items. These items support twilight coverages.

member.summary: Adds the specified item to the current instance.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.SpecificCoverage.Add(Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Coverages.SpecificCoverageItemUnit)
member.summary: Adds the (which supports twilight coverages) to the current instance.
member.exception: Expected item should be a non-null instance of SpecificCoverageItemUnit.
member.remarks: This adds a whole to the SpecificCoverage. To add or remove a to this coverage, you need to get the corresponding coverage item, get the coverage of the item and use add/remove in that coverage and re-add it to the specific coverage. For example, if you have an item for December 31st that covers 12:00pm - 1:00 and you want to add another one the same day from 2:00pm - 3:00pm. You need to get this item, get the coverage property and use coverage.Add(CoverageDayOffset, DailyCoverageItem) to add the 2-3pm range and use specificCoverage.Add(SpecificCoverageItemUnit) to add it to the SpecificCoverage, and lastly set it to the Schedule via Schedule.Coverage.

member.summary: Removes the (which supports twilight coverages) to the current instance.
member.exception: Item should be a non-null instance of SpecificCoverageItemUnit.
member.remarks: This removes a whole . To remove a remarks.

member.remarks: DoNotSerialize attribute makes the WebSDK ignore this property for serialization. Without it, the WebSDK will try to recursively serialize this object. member.remarks: A WeeklyCoverage object contains exactly 7 DailyCoverage, one for each day of the week. Every DailyCoverages object contains a list of DailyCoverageItems The DailyCoverageItems object has the information of each start time and end time. member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.CustomEvents.CustomEvent.IsBeingCreatedByPlugin
member.summary: This has been added to mimic the behaviour of a custom event when it is built from the proxy (vs from sdk engine creation). Because, when the custom event is added to the proxy, if the owner is a plugin, the Role is set to Guid.Empty and only the plugin sub type is set to the custom event sub type. So getting the Role from a custom engine that is built from the proxy will be Guid.Empty so we need this property to return the same Guid.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.CustomEntity
member.summary: Entity type with definable type descriptors.
member.remarks: This class contains two persisted fields and and two non persisted fields and . The recommended best practices for using these fields are as follows. Reserve one of the persistent fields for configuration that will be modified by users in the Config Tool but not by the owner role and the other for configuration that is either static or will be only modified by the owner role and not any users. For the non persisted state fields try to group smaller and more frequently modified pieces of state together in one field and larger or less frequently modified portions in the other. The reasoning behind these suggestions is to help simplify your logic and to perserve network bandwidth.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ILocatable
member.summary: Defines propeties associated with the geographical location of an
member.remarks: ILocatable is implemented by physical entities in the Sdk to represent the physical location of the device itself.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ILocatable.TimeZone
member.summary: Gets the time zone associated with the locatable .
member.remarks: The time zone is used to display the entity events in the entity’s local time zone. In the Security Center Sdk, all times are reported in UTC but can be displayed according to the local time zone of the entity in question. Use this property in order to convert from UTC to the device's local time zone.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.ILocatable.GeographicalLocation
member.summary: Gets the geographical location of the locatable .

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.GeographicalLocation
member.summary: Represents the physical location of an .
member.remarks:
The geographical location (latitude, longitude) of an has several different uses:
For video units, it is used for the automatic calculation of the time the sun rises and sets on a given date. A typical application is for the system to record video only during daytime (for cameras placed outside), or to adjust the brightness of the camera based on daytime and nighttime. For more information, see Schedule.
For fixed LPR units that are not equipped with a GPS receiver, the geographical location is used to plot the LPR events (reads and hits) associated to the LPR unit on the map in Security Desk. For more information, see Hits and Reads investigation tasks in Genetec Security Desk User Guide.

member.summary: Gets or sets the latitude for this .

member.summary: Gets or sets the longitude for this .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether recorded file cleanup will be done automatically.

member.value: true if automatic cleanup is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.IRecordingConfiguration.DefaultManualRecordingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the default manual recording time.
member.remarks: Recording duration when recording is started by a user. The user can stop the recording any time before the duration expires. This value is also used by the Start recording action, when the default recording length is selected.
member.value: The default manual recording time with a minimum value of 2 and a maximum value of 1440 minutes.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.IRecordingConfiguration.PostEventRecordingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the post event recording time.
member.remarks: Recording duration when recording is triggered by motion detection. During this period, the recording cannot be stopped by the user.
member.value: A representing the post event recording time with a minimum value of 0 and a maximum value of 300 seconds.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.IRecordingConfiguration.PreEventRecordingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the pre event recording time.
member.remarks: Duration of the recording buffer. This buffer is saved whenever the recording starts, ensuring that whatever prompted the recording is also captured on video.
member.value: A representing the pre event recording time with a minimum value of 0 and a maximum value of 300.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.IRecordingConfiguration.ScheduledRecordingModes
member.summary: Gets the scheduled recording modes.
member.remarks:
The Archiver can apply different recording modes at different times.
A specific can be linked to only one
Recording schedules of the same type may not overlap, regardless of the recording mode configured for each. When a scheduling conflict exists, the Archiver and the video units are displayed in yellow in the entity browser and will issue entity warning messages.
member.value: A read only collection of objects.

member.summary: Represent a Backup task
member.remarks: A contains the configuration to launch a manual or a persistent video backup operation. All instances are either created or returned by the class with the methods and . To start a transfer operation, use the method.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.BackupTask.AbsoluteRanges
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of absolute to transfer. Supports UTC and local time (local to the SDK application). Values are converted to UTC before being used. The same UTC values apply to each camera.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.BackupTask.AdditionalStartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time of an additional time range to transfer. Only the time of the day is used, the date part is ignored. The time is local to each camera. The time value is used "as-is", ignoring the .
member.remarks: If you want to configure an Additional time range to transfer, you can set or and . If is not set to 0, that value will be used and and will be ignored.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.BackupTask.AdditionalStopTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the stop time of an additional time range to transfer. Only the time of the day is used, the date part is ignored. The time is local to each camera. The time value is used "as-is", ignoring the .
member.remarks: If you want to configure an additional time range to transfer, you can set or and . If is not set to 0, that value will be used and and will be ignored.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.summary: Gets the unique id representing the transfer

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where an input pin state has changed.

This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.BackupTask.MotionEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where archiving was triggered by motion.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.BackupTask.VideoAnalyticsEvents

This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.BackupTask.GetCookie

The transfer is persistent
or The transfer is not started

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask
member.summary: Represent a Duplication task
member.remarks: A contains the configuration to launch a manual or a persistent duplicate archive operation. All instances are either created or returned by the class with the methods and . To start a transfer operation, use the method.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.AbsoluteRanges
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of absolute to transfer. Supports UTC and local time (local to the SDK application). Values are converted to UTC before being used. The same UTC values apply to each camera.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.AdditionalStartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time of an additional time range to transfer. Only the time of the day is used, the date part is ignored. The time is local to each camera. The time value is used "as-is", ignoring the .
member.remarks: If you want to configure an additional time range to transfer, you can set or and . If is not set to 0, that value will be used and and will be ignored.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.AdditionalStopTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the stop time of an additional time range to transfer. Only the time of the day is used, the date part is ignored. The time is local to each camera. The time value is used "as-is", ignoring the .
member.remarks: If you want to configure an additional time range to transfer, you can set or and . If is not set to 0, that value will be used and and will be ignored.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.Alarms
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where archiving was triggered by an alarm.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.ArchiverId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the destination archiver role.
member.remarks: Only the primary server of an archiver role will be set as the destination of the transfer.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.Bookmarks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where a bookmark is present.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.Cameras
member.summary: List the camera source that is transfered. Can only be modified when using a custom transfer group.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.FriendlyName
member.summary: Gets the name of the transfer

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique id representing the transfer

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.InputTriggers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where an input pin state has changed.
member.remarks: If no video sequence is available at the time of an input pin state has changed, no video will be transfered for that specific time.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.IsPersistent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the transfer is persisted.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.LastPeriodInMinute
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional time range to transfer based on the last X minutes.
member.remarks: If you want to configure an additional time range to transfer, you can set or and . If is not set to 0, that value will be used and and will be ignored.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.MotionEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where archiving was triggered by motion.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.OffloadAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to add after the sequence that will be tranfered.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.OffloadBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to add before the sequence that will be tranfered.
member.remarks: This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.VideoAnalyticsEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to transfer sequences where a video analytic event was triggered.
member.remarks: If no video sequence is available at the time of a video analytic event was triggered, no video will be transfered for that specific time.
This property can only be modified when using a custom transfer otherwise it is read-only.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ArchiveBackup.DuplicationTask.GetCookie
member.summary: Returns a cookie that can be used to persist a transfer task config that was already started.
member.remarks: Use the method to start monitoring between different SDK session. The cookie has no life limit, but non-persistent transfer are not keep infinitely by the Archiver role so after some time, no transfer state will be updated.
member.exception:
The transfer is persistent
or The transfer is not started

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration
member.summary: Interface to the motion detection configuration

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.ConsecutiveFrameHits
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the number of consecutive frames with motion higher than the motion on threshold that are needed for motion detection to be considered valid.
member.remarks: Setting this parameter higher than 1 helps avoid false motion detection hits, such as from video noise in a single frame. This setting ensures that positive motion detection is only reported when a hit is observed over a certain number of consecutive frames. When enough consecutive hits have been observed, the first hit in the series is marked as the beginning of motion.
member.exception: The ConsecutiveFrameHits value must be between 1 and 127

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.H264ChromaWeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) representing how the difference in chroma (color) values between consecutive frames affects motion detection
member.exception: The H264ChromaWeight value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.H264LumaWeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) representing the importance of luma (brightness) difference between frames to detect motion
member.exception: The H264LumaWeight value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.H264MacroblockWeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) representing the importance of macroblocks (intra-macroblocks) to detect motion
member.exception: The H264MacroblockWeight value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.H264VectorWeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) representing the importance of vector values (movement) difference between frames to detect motion
member.exception: The H264VectorWeight value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or Sets a flag indicating if the motion dection is enabled for the time period covered by its schedule

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.IsH264
member.summary: Gets or Sets a flag indicating if the current stream is an H264 stream and if the H264 specific settings are to be used

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.MaximumZoneCount
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value that represents the maximum number of different motion zones this camera supports

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.MotionDetectionType
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing whether the motion detection is made on the Archiver (software) or the Unit (hardware)

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.Schedule
member.summary: Gets or Sets the unique id of the schedule on which this configuration is running

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) that controls how much difference must be detected in a block between two consecutive frames before it is considered as motion.
member.remarks: With the sensibility set to the maximum (100%), the slightest variation in an image block is detected as motion. Lowering the sensitivity reduces the number of motion blocks detected in the video. Only set the sensitivity lower than 100% if your equipment is prone to generate noise.
member.exception: The Sensitivity value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.Zones
member.summary: Gets the list of the different motion detection zones that are configured

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionConfiguration.UpdateZones(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration})
member.summary: Updates the list of motion detection zones with provided values
member.param: The new list of motion detection zones to be used
member.exception: Custom implementations of the IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration class are not supported
The list provided in the arguments cannot be null

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration
member.summary: Interface to the motion detection zone configuration

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MacroBlockHeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the height of a macro block (usually 16 pixels)
member.remarks: A block is called a motion block when motion is detected in it. There is positive motion in a video image when the area covered by the block detects motion in consecutive video frames. The number of motion blocks detected represents the amount of motion. A motion block is represented by a semi-transparent square overlay on the video image.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MacroBlockWidth
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the width of a macro block (usually 16 pixels)
member.remarks: A block is called a motion block when motion is detected in it. There is positive motion in a video image when the area covered by the block detects motion in consecutive video frames. The number of motion blocks detected represents the amount of motion. A motion block is represented by a semi-transparent square overlay on the video image.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.Map
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the outlining of the area in which motion can be detected. Also referred to as the motion mask
member.remarks: Defines where on the video image motion should be detected. For the purpose of motion detection, the video image is divided into a large number of macro blocks (1,320 for NTSC encoding standard and 1,584 for PAL). Each of these blocks can be individually turned on/off for motion detection.
member.exception: The Map cannot be set to null

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MapHeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the height of the map in macroblocks (the vertical number macro blocks)

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MapWidth
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the width of the map in macroblocks (the horizontal number of macro blocks)

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MotionOnEvent
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the id event that will be launched at the beginning of the motion period

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MotionOnThreshold
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) representing the percentage of motion that is needed to trigger the configured Motion on event.
member.remarks: Should be higher than the motion off threshold.
member.exception: The MotionOnThreshold value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MotionOffEvent
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value representing the id of event that will be fired at the end of the motion period

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.MotionOffThreshold
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) representing the percentage of motion that is needed to trigger the configured Motion off event.
member.remarks: This can only occur after the motion on threshold is reached, followed by the percentage going below the motion off threshold. Should be lower than the motion on threshold.
member.exception: The MotionOffThreshold value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value between 0 (lowest) and 100 (highest) that controls how much difference must be detected in a block between two consecutive frames before it is considered as motion.
member.remarks: With the sensibility set to the maximum (100%), the slightest variation in an image block is detected as motion. Lowering the sensitivity reduces the number of motion blocks detected in the video. Only set the sensitivity lower than 100% if your equipment is prone to generate noise.
member.exception: The Sensitivity value must be between 0 and 100

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.GetMotionThresholdInBlocks(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the motion on/off threshold in blocks calculated based on a value as a percentage and the total map size in macroblocks. Values are rounded to the nearest integral numer.
member.exception: The provided percentage must be between 0 and 100

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.MotionDetection.IMotionDetectionZoneConfiguration.GetMotionThresholdInPercent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the motion on/off threshold in percentage calculated based on a value as a number of blocks and the total map size in macroblocks.
member.exception: The provided number of blocks must be between 0 and the max number of blocks

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration
member.summary: RecordingConfiguration class
member.remarks:
This class contains all the properties pretaining to recording and retention configuration of a .
If the camera is associated to additional Auxiliary Archiver roles, you’ll find one group of settings for each archiving role the camera is associated to. For each recording configuration, the camera can follow the settings inherited from the role or use its own custom settings.
The recording configuration of a camera will carry it's archiver's recording configuration if the settings are inhertied.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.AudioRecording
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether audio is recorded.
member.remarks: Turn this option on to record audio along with video. A microphone entity must be attached to the related camera entity for this option to work.
member.value: true if audio recording is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.AutomaticCleanup
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether recorded file cleanup will be done automatically.
member.remarks: Turn this option on to delete the recorded video after a certain number of days, regardless whether the archiving storage is full or not.
member.value: true if automatic cleanup is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.DefaultManualRecordingTime
member.summary: Gets the default manual recording time.
member.remarks: Recording duration when recording is started by a user. The user can stop the recording any time before the duration expires. This value is also used by the Start recording action, when the default recording length is selected.
member.value: The default manual recording time with a minimum value of 2 and a maximum value of 1440 minutes.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.PostEventRecordingTime
member.summary: Gets the post event recording time.
member.remarks: Recording duration when recording is triggered by motion detection. During this period, the recording cannot be stopped by the user.
member.value: A representing the post event recording time with a minimum value of 0 and a maximum value of 300 seconds.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.PreEventRecordingTime
member.summary: Gets the pre event recording time.
member.remarks: Duration of the recording buffer. This buffer is saved whenever the recording starts, ensuring that whatever prompted the recording is also captured on video.
member.value: A representing the pre event recording time with a minimum value of 0 and a maximum value of 300 seconds.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.RedundantArchiving
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether archiving is redundant.
member.remarks: Turn this option on to allow both primary and secondary servers to archive video at the same time. This setting is effective only if failover is configured.
member.value: true if redundant archiving is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.RetentionPeriod
member.summary: Gets the retention period.
member.remarks: This value is related to
member.value: A representing the retention period in days.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.ScheduledRecordingModes
member.summary: Gets the scheduled recording modes.
member.remarks:
The Archiver can apply different recording modes at different times.
A specific can be linked to only one
Recording schedules of the same type may not overlap, regardless of the recording mode configured for each. When a scheduling conflict exists, the Archiver and the video units are displayed in yellow in the entity browser and will issue entity warning messages.
member.value: A read only collection of objects.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.UseCustomRecordingSettings
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the recording configuration will be custom set, or inherited from the archiver.
member.remarks: If this boolean is set to true the settings are not being inherited from the parent archiver.
member.value: true if use custom recording settings are being used; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.RecordingConfiguration.EncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the recording is encrypted.
member.value: true if use custom recording settings are being used; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.ScheduledRecordingMode
member.summary: A class containing a identifier and a associated to it. This class also contains some default .

remarks.para: The available recording modes are:
Off: Recording is off. This mode prevents recording from taking place, not even when an alarm is triggered.
Continuous: Records continuously. Recording cannot be stopped by the user.

On motion/Manual: Records when recording is triggered by an action (such as Start recording, Add bookmark, or Trigger alarm), via motion detection, or manually by a user. In this mode, the Record button in Security Desk appears grey when the Archiver is not recording, red when it is recording but can be stopped by the user, or red with lock when it is recording but cannot be stopped by the user (on motion or alarm recording).
Manual: Same as On motion/Manual. The only difference is that motion will not trigger any recording.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.VideoCompressionConfiguration.FrameRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the framerate.
member.remarks: the number of frames per second (fps). A high frame rate (10 fps or more) produces fluid video and is essential for accurate motion detection. However, increasing the frame rate also sends more information over the network, and therefore, requires more bandwidth.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.VideoCompressionConfiguration.ImageQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the image quality.
member.remarks:
The higher the value of image quality, the better the quality. Higher image quality requires more bandwidth, which may compromise the frame rate. When bandwidth is limited, you should consider the following:
To retain very good image quality, restrict the number of images per second (lower frame rate).
To transmit more images per second at a high frame rate, lower the image quality. The encoder will always try to maintain each quality setting. However, if bandwidth is limited, the encoder may reduce the frame rate in favor of the image quality.
member.value: An integer representing the image quality.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.VideoCompressionConfiguration.IsImageCropped
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is image cropped.
member.value: true if this instance is image cropped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Video.VideoCompressionConfiguration.KeyframeInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the keyframe interval.
member.remarks: A key frame is a frame that contains a complete image by itself as opposed to a usual frame that only holds information that changed compared to the previous frame. You would need a higher key frame rate to recover more rapidly from cumulative errors in the video when the network is less reliable. Frequent key frames require a higher bandwidth. You can specify the key frame interval in seconds (1 to 20) or by frames (based on the frame rate).
member.value: An integer representing the keyframe interval.

member.summary: See

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Reader.DisableCardAndPin
member.summary: Disables the card and pin functionality associated with this .
member.remarks:
Disabling card and pin puts the reader in card or pin node. Either a valid card or pin credential will unlock a , or floor.
Note that, depending on the make and model, changing the card and pin mode of a reader may result in the temporary disruption of access control functionality while it is being re-programmed.

The failure timeout. See the CardAndPintimeout property for details.

Note that, depending on the make and model, changing the card and pin mode of a reader may result in the temporary disruption of access control functionality while it is being re-programmed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The given name of the attachment. This is the name that will appear on the email as the name of the attachment.
The byte array that represents the file to attach.
member.exception: Exception thrown if the filename is invalid.
Exception thrown if the content size is larger than 10 MB.

example.code: var content = File.ReadAllBytes(@"C:\My Documents\mytest.pdf"); var attachment = new EmailAttachment("MyPDFFile.pdf", content);

member.remarks: To convert a file to byte[] use File.ReadAllBytes(string filename). Make sure the extension is included in the filename property for every attachment and that it matches the one from the file that is to be attached.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream
member.summary: VideoStream class representing a stream of video generated by a video encoder.

remarks.para: Each video encoder can generate one or more video streams.

Video quality is defined by a host of parameters such as image resolution, bit rate, frame rate, and so on, that can vary depending on the manufacturer. The video quality can have multiple configurations based on different schedules. For example, lower resolution might be required for regular hours when there is a lot of activity in the office, while higher resolution might be used after closing time when less human surveillance is available.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream.m_boVideoStream
member.summary: Represent the owned video stream internal entity

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream.BoostQualityOnEventRecording
member.summary: Gets the video compression to be used when motion recording is triggered.
member.remarks:
Temporarily boosts video quality when the recording is triggered by a system event.
The events that qualify as event recording are as follows:
The Start recording action was executed
The recording was triggered by an alarm
The recording was triggered by motion
member.value: A object containing video compression configuration.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream.BoostQualityOnManualRecording
member.summary: Gets the video compression to be used when manual recording is triggered

remarks.para: Temporarily boosts video quality when the recording is started manually by a user.
The actions that trigger manual recording are as follows:
The Record button is clicked by a Security Desk user
The Add a bookmark button is clicked by a Security Desk user

member.value: A object containing video compression configuration.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream.MulticastAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the multicast address of the video stream.

remarks.para:
If the set passes, the multicast address may shortly after be rejected by the MediaRouter for one or more of the following reasons:
The multicast address is already assigned to a device in the system.
Other manufacturer specific limitations.
Clients wishing to set the multicast address should subscribe to the event to receive notification in case the MediaRouter decides to change the address or port number for one reason or another.

member.value: The end point containing the multicast address and the port number.
member.exception: Endpoint does not represent a valid multicast address.
Endpoint port number should be even for this usage.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream.PreferredConnectionType
member.summary: Gets or Sets the preferred connection type

remarks.para: The Archiver may not necessarily respect the setting based on what is possible. It is a preferred connection type only.
The value set cannot be of type StreamConnectionType.Unknown.
The value set cannot be a composite of multiple StreamConnectionType values, it has to be a single value.
The value set must be one of the .

member.value: A object containing the stream's preferred connection type.
member.exception: A SdkException is thrown if the value is StreamConnectionType.Unknown, if it's a composite of multiple StreamConnectionTypes or if it's not one of the SupportedConnectionTypes.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStream.SupportedConnectionTypes
member.summary: Gets the supported connection types
member.value: A object containing the stream's supported connection types in a bitwise format.

member.summary: Gets the video compression capabilities supported by that stream

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoStreamUsage
member.summary: VideoStreamUsage class. This class relates a to a .
member.remarks:
A stream can be assigned all, some, or none of the usage options. A stream that has no usage is not generated by the video encoder. The stream usage defines the purpose of the stream. You can select from the following options:
Live – Default stream used for viewing live video in Security Desk.
Recording – Stream recorded by the Archiver for future investigation. The quality of the recording stream can be temporarily boosted when the recording is triggered by certain types of events.
Remote – Stream used for live viewing when the bandwidth is limited.
Low resolution – Stream used instead of the Live stream when the tile used to view the stream in Security Desk is small.
High resolution – Stream used instead of the Live stream when the tile used to view the stream in Security Desk is large.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.CurrentSignalState
member.summary: Gets the current signal state of the specified .
member.value: The current signal state. One of: , or .
member.remarks:
The signal state property only applies to certain models of analog encoder. Normally, an analog encoder experiences a signal lost condition when the connection between the camera and its parent encoder is broken. In the case of an IP camera the signal state will always be .
Depending on camera make and model there are two possible initial signal states for a given camera. If the camera supports actively querying signal state the initial value will be one of or . If the camera only supports sending the signal lost event the initial state of the camera will be until an initial signal lost condition occurs. Following the initial state change the value will remain up to date as long as Security Center is running.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.AddVideoProtection(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Protects video sequences associated with this from deletion.
member.param: The start time of the sequence to protect expressed in UTC.
The end time of the sequence to protect expressed in UTC.
The duration for which the video should be protected. For example, the next 5 days.
member.remarks: Use this method to protect one or more archived video sequences from deletion. The minimum duration is 1 day. Protection is applied immediately to any archived sequences that fit within span indicated. The sequences will remain protected for the specified duration. When protection ends the sequences will be deleted subject to archiver role's automatic cleanup schedule. Specifying a duration of will protect the specified span indefinitely. To remove protection from a video sequence use . To protect video as it is being archived use .
member.exception: Either of the DateTime values specified is DateTimeKind.Unspecified.
The specified start time is after the specified end time.
The specified end time is in the future.
The specified duration is less than 1 day.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.Block(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the camera with the specified blocking level for the specified time period. Users who's level is above the blocking level will not be able to view video for the duration of the blocking.
member.param: The start time of the blocking.
The end time of the blocking.
The desired level of the blocking [1-253].
member.remarks: It is only possible to block with blocking level greater or equal than the user level of the person blocking the camera. This will be verified automatically using the currently logged on user. It is possible to overlap blockings. In this case, the latest blocking shall overwrite the previous blocking only where they overlap. Of course Users with levels higher than those who created the initial blocking will not be allowed to change the blockingLevel. If the user making the request only has sufficient permissions to modify part of his requested timerange then only that part will be modified.
member.exception: If the blocking starts after now or the duration is not positive.
If the connected user tries to block above their own level.
If the current user is not allowed to to this block.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.StartRecording(System.TimeSpan,Genetec.Sdk.RecordingInitiator)
member.summary: Start the recording on this camera.
member.remarks: This method is obsolete and will be removed in a subsequent version. Use instead. All recording triggered through the Sdk automatically has a of .

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.StartRecording(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Triggers video recording for the specified .
member.param: A indicating the desired recording duration.
member.remarks:
Calling this method immediately triggers video recording for the specified duration. The associated with the request is and will appear as such in the and related archive event reports. Note that if the configured for the is the request will be ignored.
All recording requests are treated in a layered fashion. For example, if a user requests manual recording with a default manual recording length of 5 minutes and an external Sdk request is made 1 minute later for 5 minutes, the archiver will record for a total of 6 minutes. Requests are also treated by priority. For example, if a user issues a manual request as in the example above and an external request is received, the user will be unable to stop manual recording until the duration associated with external request has elapsed. Recording triggered by an alarm or an external request will take priority over recording triggered by motion or manual requests.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.StartRecording(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triggers video recording for the specified .
member.param: A indicating the desired recording duration.
Boolean value indicating if the recording state should be LockedOn or On when recording.
member.remarks:
Note that if the configured for the is the request will be ignored.
All recording requests are treated in a layered fashion. For example, if a user requests manual recording with a default manual recording length of 5 minutes and an external Sdk request is made 1 minute later for 5 minutes, the archiver will record for a total of 6 minutes. Requests are also treated by priority. For example, if a user issues a manual request as in the example above and an external request is received, the user will be unable to stop manual recording until the duration associated with external request has elapsed. Recording triggered by an alarm or an external request will take priority over recording triggered by motion or manual requests.
member.exception: The specified camera guid could not be retreived.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Camera.StartVideoProtection(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Starts protecting video associated with this as it is archived.
member.param: The span of video to protect. For example, the next 5 minutes.
The duration of time for which to protect the video. For example, the next 5 days.
member.remarks: Use this method to protect any video archived in the next span minutes. The minimum duration is 1 day. Protection begins immediately and continues for the specified span. The video will remain protected for the specified duration. Note that only recorded video will be protected and this method does not trigger recording. To start recording video call . To protect a video sequence that has already been archived use instead.
member.exception: The specified duration is less than 1 day.

members.member:
Adds a user or a user group access to this partition so it can see the entities under this partition.
User or user group An SdkException can be thrown for the following reasons: -The user or user group specified does not exist or you do not have write access to this user -You do not have write access to this partition -You passed an entity of another type than a user or user group

member.summary: Gets the set of access rules associated with this .

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Elevator.UnlockExceptionSchedules
member.summary: Gets the unlock exception (controlled access) schedules associated with this
member.value: A collection of unique identifiers of entities.
member.remarks:
An unlock exception schedule defines a period where the specified is under controlled access. Exceptions are applied over the existing set of access rules to adjust access permissions during specific periods.
This property applies to all floors. If you wish to apply the schedule to specific floors use the property associated with instead.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Elevator.UnlockSchedules
member.summary: Get the unlock schedules (free access) associatd with this .
member.value: A collection of unique identifiers of entities.
member.remarks:
An unlock schedule defines a period where the specified is free access. Exceptions are applied over the existing set of access rules to adjust access permissions during specific periods.
This property applies to all floors. If you wish to apply the schedule to specific floors use the property associated with instead.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Elevator.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Elevator.AddAccessRule(System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds the specified to this granting all related cardholders and cardholder groups access to the on the specified .
member.param: The unique identifier of the access rule to associate with this .
member.exception: The accessRule parameter is an empty .
The accessRule parameter does not correspond to a valid .
member.remarks: Adding an access rule to an Elevator is essentially the same as manually associating it with all of its floors. The access rule is added to each and every floor in the current set of associated floors. If a floor is added at a later time it will not automatically inherit the access rules associated with the elevator.

member.summary: Removes the assigned reader device from the elevator cabin reader.
member.remarks: This method removes the reader device attached to the cabin of the elevator. This is only allowed to the owner role of the elevator. If the elevator has no role owner, this method will throw an exception.
member.exception: You only have read access on this member since it is an entity that you do not own.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Elevator.RemoveAccessRule(System.Guid)
member.summary: Removes the specified from its association with this .
member.param: The unique identifier of the access rule to associate with this .
member.exception: The accessRule parameter is an empty .
The accessRule parameter does not correspond to a valid .
member.remarks: Removing an access rule from an elevator is essentially the same as manually removing it from all of its floors. The access rule will be removed from each floor to which it has been mapped.

member.summary: Sets the reader device to be used as the cabin reader of the elevator.
member.param: The guid of the reader that will be attached to the cabin of the elevator.
member.remarks: This method allows to set the reader device to the cabin of the elevator. This is only allowed to the owner role of the elevator. If the elevator has no role owner, this method will throw an exception.
member.exception: You only have read access on this member since it is an entity that you do not own.
The cabin reader guid cannot be empty.
Unable to retrieve this reader. Verify the value provided corresponds to a reader.
Unable to retrieve the unit this reader belongs to. Verify this reader has a parent unit.
Unable to set this reader because it is attached to another access point.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoUnit.TimeZone
member.summary: Gets the time zone associated with the locatable .
member.remarks: The time zone is used to display the entity events in the entity’s local time zone. In the Security Center Sdk, all times are reported in UTC but can be displayed according to the local time zone of the entity in question. Use this property in order to convert from UTC to the device's local time zone.
member.exception: If the TimeZoneInfo can not be located based on Id.
If an unepxected exception occurred while processing the Sdk request.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoUnit.UseDefaultLogon
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to use the default logon credentials for this .
member.value: true if the video unit is set to use default logon credentials; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true the archiver role will use the default credentials found in the video unit's extension settings when logging in to the . The specific username and password properties for this will be ignored.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.VideoUnit.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets the username to be used when connecting to this .
member.remarks: The username is used by the archiver role for logging in to this . If username is not supported for this video unit type or the detault logon option is used this property may be empty.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Alarm
member.summary: Encapsulates an alarm entity.
member.remarks: The alarm entity describes a particular trouble situation that requires immediate attention, and how it should be handled in Security Center. Namely, its priority, what entities (usually cameras and doors) best describe it, who should be notified, how it should be displayed to the user, and so on.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Area.AddCaptiveDoor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds a captive door (not perimeter) to this area
member.remarks: Doors that are members of the area can be configured as Captive or Perimeter doors. Perimeter doors are used to enter and exit an area, and help to control access. Captive doors are doors inside the area. By correctly setting the door sides, people counting and antipassback are properly tracked. A door’s Entrance and Exit sides are relative to the area being configured.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Area.AddCashRegister(System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds a cash register to this area.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Area.AddDoor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds a perimeter door to this area.
member.remarks:
Doors that are members of the area can be configured as Captive or Perimeter doors. Perimeter doors are used to enter and exit an area, and help to control access. Captive doors are doors inside the area. By correctly setting the door sides, people counting and antipassback are properly tracked. A door’s Entrance and Exit sides are relative to the area being configured.
DoorSide will be for entering the Area and DoorSide will be for exiting the Area

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Area.SwitchPerimeterDoorSides(System.Guid)
member.summary: If the provided door is a perimeter door of this area, this method switches the door sides with regards to entering and exiting the area.
member.remarks: Example: If the door side is configured to enter the area and the door side is configured to exit the area, this method will invert that relationship such that side enters this area and side exits it.
member.exception: The door is not a perimeter door for this area or the door sides are misconfigured for this Area.
member.param: The perimeter door whose sides we want to switch.

member.summary: Gets or sets if this is exempted from antipassback rules.
member.value: true if this is exempt from antipassback rules; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An antipassback violation occurs when a cardholder enters an area that he never exited, or when he exits an area that he never entered. This can occur when an authorized cardholder unlocks a door, and while entering, passes their card back to somebody else.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Cardholder.Picture
member.summary: Gets or Sets the photo of the cardholder.

remarks.p: The setter can set pictures for native cardholders and Active Directory cardholders. It throws an SdkException for federated cardholders or cardholders owned by a plugin (unless the plugin is setting the picture of one of its cardholder).
For Active Directory cardholders, the cardholder images will be uploaded at the next Active Directory synchronization and the synchronization synchronizes everything.
Other conditions for a picture set in Security Center to be uploaded to the Active Directory:
- the Active Directory role must have the "Upload picture to Active Directory" option enabled.
- a link must be configured between the Security Center Cardholder picture field and the Active Directory cardholder attribute. Refer to the Security Center Administrator Guide.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.AccessPoint
member.summary: Represents a secure access point.
member.remarks: An is any monitored point that can be used to enter or exit a secured area, usually a or an elevator . Note that an elevator floor can only be used as an entry point. Access points typically have device hardware attached. They may also encapsulate other access points. For example, an elevator is associated with a to which an input device is attached for floor tracking.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Entity
member.summary: Abstract class used to retrieve basic information about an entity.
member.remarks: The DebuggerDisplay attributes will override the default method of this class with property during the debugging of this Entity class. This override only happens while debugging an entity in visual studio. This will be used when the programmer is trying to debug an Entity that is not in the Entity Cache. Instead of having visual studio in a Deadlock while debugging, it will display the property instead.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Entity.DebuggerName
member.summary: Gets the name of entity specifically while in the debug mode of Visual Studio.
member.value: The name of the entity that is returned while debugging.
member.remarks: When debugging in visual studio, the debugger enters in a Deadlock when it tries to load the Method on an entity that is not loaded in the entity cache. The reason that happens is because the debugger calls the method on this class when trying to show the name of the Entity in the "locals" or "watch". The method tries to call the Name on an entity that is not yet loaded in the entity cache. Since the Name is not in the cache, it makes a call to the directory to retrieve the Name of the entity. The effect of this problem is that Visual Studio "hangs" for a couple of seconds before the user is able to step more in the code. It can cause Visual Studio to show a windows to the user asking him to "Browse" for a missing class while debugging. This property will replace the ToString property while Visual Studio is in Debug Mode. It will not make Visual Studio "hang" by providing it with a default Debugger version of the ToString().

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.SystemConfiguration.CustomFields
member.summary: Gets the list of all the custom fields in the system.

remarks.para: It is mandatary to create or add a Custom Field inside a transaction.
It is possible to modify a Custom Field without using a transaction.
You can use the indexers [] to access the CustomField by its name and type.

Once a Custom Field is added and created in the system, it is not possible to modify the Data Type of the Custom Field. This can be verified using Security Center in the Custom Field tab. Once created, the Custom Field's Data Type cannot be modified.
This property represents the CustomField configuration, it does not contain the Value of the custom field
To get or set the value of a Custom Field for an entityType, use the property.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.User.PasswordExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets the default number of day(s) before the user's password expires. (0 through 999 days)
member.exception: PasswordExpiration;The password expiration value must be greater than or equal to zero. or PasswordExpiration;The password expiration value must be less than or equal to 999.

remarks.para: When this property is set to 0, the password never expires.
When this property is set to greater than 0, the password will expire after the set amount of days.
We cannot set the Password Expiration to be less than 0 or greater than 999 days

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.User.PasswordLastModified
member.summary: Gets the date and time when the user's password was last modified.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.User.Privileges
member.summary: Gets the privileges defined for this user, without influence from any UserGroups this user belongs to.

remarks.para: A privilege set at the level overrides its inherited privilege settings.

In some situations, these could differ from what the Config Tool displays for the given user, because the Config Tool replaces Undefined values with parent values if applicable. An example is when a new user is created without applying a privilege template, but belongs to a UserGroup; this property will return Undefined values wereas the Config Tool will display the UserGroup values.
Returns a copy of the privileges. To modify privileges, use or one of its overload.
To verify the effective state of a privilege for a user, use or one of its overload.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.User.PtzPriorities
member.summary: Get a Read only collection of associated .

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.User.SecurityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the security level associated to this .
member.exception: The security level value must be greater than or equal to 1. or The security level value must be less than or equal to 254.

remarks.para: If the property is true , it will return the SecurityLevel of the parent.
If the property is false, it will return with its own SecurityLevel.
When setting the property, set the property to false to activate this User's custom SecurityLevel.
1 is the Maximum Security Level.
254 is the Minimum Security Level.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Entities.User.TimespanBeforePasswordExpires
member.summary: Returns the timespan before the user's password expires
member.returns: TimeSpan.MaxValue if password aging is not enabled. Negative value if password is expired. Positive value otherwise.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.DiagnosticServer
member.summary: The provides access to the Genetec Console in client applications which includes the Security Center logging framework and commands.

remarks.para: You can use the class to log information to the logging framework; make sure to call InitializeServer before instanciating the loggers.
You can use the and attributes to define debug methods which will be available from the web interface to the

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.DiagnosticServer.InitializeServer(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the with an empty password. Requires the process to run with administrative privileges.
member.param: The port number to use for the .
The port for the web interface to the
member.exception: The InitializeServer() method has already been called.
member.remarks:
Access to the web interface for the server can be obtained through the following url Http://host:webServerPort/Console where host is the IP or DNS name of the machine running the process hosting the DiagnosticServer.
If this call causes issues loading dlls (e.g. Microsoft.Owin.dll, Newtonsoft.Json.dll), change the app.config so it includes the same BindingRedirects as SecurityDesk.exe.config.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.DiagnosticServer.InitializeServer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the , specifying the password required to connect to the console. Requires the process to run with administrative privileges.
member.param: The port number to use for the .
The port for the web interface to the
the password required for the web interface to the
member.exception: The InitializeServer() method has already been called.
member.remarks:
Access to the web interface for the server can be obtained through the following url Http://host:webServerPort/Console where host is the IP or DNS name of the machine running the process hosting the DiagnosticServer.
If this call causes issues loading dlls (e.g. Microsoft.Owin.dll, Newtonsoft.Json.dll), change the app.config so it includes the same BindingRedirects as SecurityDesk.exe.config.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.GNetServer
member.summary: The GNetServer provides access to the Genetec Console in client applications which includes the Security Center logging framework and commands. In order for the GNetServer to initialize, the executing application requires a valid .exe.gconfig
member.seealso: You can use the Logger class to log information to the logging framework.

member.summary: Gets the instance of the singleton.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether GNetServer is initialized.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.GNetServer.InitializeGNetServer
member.summary: Initializes the
member.exception: The InitializeGNetServer() method has already been called.
member.remarks: This method requires a valid .exe.gconfig file that is named after the current executing assembly or it will fail to initialize. Initialization will silently fail if it does not succeed.

member.summary: All of the possible log severities in the Security Center logging framework.

member.summary: All Log Severity, represents all of the LogSeverity except Debug and Performance

member.summary: Debug Log Severity, for log messages that only developers would be interested in.

member.summary: Error Log Severity, for log messages about errors that the application can recover from

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.Core.LogSeverity.Fatal
member.summary: Fatal Log Severity, for log messages about errors that the application cannot recover from

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.Core.LogSeverity.Information
member.summary: Information Log Severity, for log messages that users would be interested in.

member.summary: None Log Severity, represents none of the LogSeverity's

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.Core.LogSeverity.Performance
member.summary: Performance Log Severity, for log messages related to measuring application performance.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.Core.LogSeverity.Warning
member.summary: Warning Log Severity, for log messages which are potential problems in the application.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.Core.LogSeverity.Full
member.summary: Full Log Severity, for logging of every Log Severity.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.DebugMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the associated method can be used in debugging and should be made accessible by the .

remarks.para: It is necessary to use an instance in the class where this attribute is used. See or the example below.
Also, for the debug methods to be available in the console, the DiagnosticServer must be initialized (DiagnosticServer.InitializeServer) before the logger is instanciated.
Debug methods can return a string, or be void.
Debug methods are invoked using reflection by the DiagnosticServer; their access modifiers have no effect on this.
Methods can be grouped in the console. See .

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.DebugMethodAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the debug method.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.DebugMethodAttribute.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the debug method. The default value is the method's name.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.DebugMethodAttribute.IsHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this debug method is hidden from intellisense.
member.value: true if this debug method is hidden; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Diagnostics.Logging.DebugMethodAttribute.IsSecured
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the debug method must be invoked in a secure context (From the local machine).
member.value: true if this instance is secured; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.EngineEntityCache
member.summary: A simple thread safe cache for keeping entities for the Engine. The class includes a TryGetEntity method to allow you to safely check and update the cache in a single operation. It also maintains it's own integrity in cases where an entity is Disposed but not removed from the cache.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.EngineEntityCache.Clear
member.summary: Calls Dispose on all entities in the cache and then calls Clear.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.EngineEntityCache.GetOrAdd(System.Guid,System.Func{System.Guid,Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Entity})
member.summary: Gets or adds an entity to the cache, if the create value factory returns null, this will NOT be added to the cache.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.EngineEntityCache.Remove(System.Guid)
member.summary: Disposes the entity object associated to the parameter and removes it from the cache.
member.param: The unique Id of the entity to remove from the cache.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.EngineEntityCache.TryGetEntity(System.Guid,Genetec.Sdk.Entities.Entity@)
member.summary: Does a check on the cache and returns the entity in a single thread safe operation.
member.param: The Guid of the entity to retrieve.
The entity we want to retrieve from the cache.
member.returns: If the entity is present in the cache it is returned; otherwise false.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Events.CustomEventInstance
member.summary: Represents an instance of a Custom Event. Before raising this event you must assign a valid CustomEventId.
member.remarks: A represents an actual instance of a with a specific message and Timestamp. The class is used to define the custom event types that are available in the system. Remember that events that are fired from SDK applications appear in the monitoring task but are not persisted and are therefore not available in reports.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Events.CustomEventInstance.Id
member.summary: The Id for the this instance represents.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Events.CustomEventInstance.Message
member.summary: The message carried by the Custom Event.
member.remarks: This message will be displayed in the description column of a monitoring task for anyone monitoring the source of this event when it is fired.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Events.Event
member.summary: The base class for events
member.remarks: Indicates the occurrence of an activity or incident, such as access denied to a cardholder or motion detected on a camera. Events are automatically logged in Security Center, and can be programmed to trigger actions, conferring intelligent behavior to the system. Every event mainly focuses on one entity, called the event source.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.LicensePlateManagement.ParkingOccupancyQuery
member.summary: Represent report queries for parking zone occupancy events.

remarks.para: The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The capacity of the parking zone.
The number of vehicles in the parking zone.
The number of violations of the parking zone.
