member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.LicensePlateManagement.ReadQuery
member.summary: A class to query license plate reads

remarks.para: The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The unique identifier of the read.
The unique identifier of the User.
The unique identifier of the LprUnit.
The unique identifier of the Patroller.
The unique identifier of the Lot. This can be Guid.Empty
The unique identifier of the permit category. This can be Guid.Empty
The unique identifier of the LprCamera.
Boolean indicating whether the read is manual or automatic.
Boolean indicating whether the read is a hit in a hotlist or not.
The overview or tire thumbnail image.
The protected information. True if it is protected, otherwise false.
The unique identifier of the shared permit rule.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AccessControl.UnusedCardholderQuery
member.summary: Class to query unused cardholders. It reports on cardholders who have never used a credential. A time range can be specified.
member.remarks:
Depending on the specific type of unused entity query being performed, the resulting will contain the unique identifier of the unused entity.
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Guid Guid The unique identifier of the unused entity (cardholder or credential).

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AccessControl.AccessControlUnitQuery
member.summary: Class to query access control unit activity. It reports on events which occur on the specified access control units such as unit connected/disconnected, hardware tamper, among others.
member.remarks:
Depending on the specific type of access control query being performed, different columns in the resulting will contain relevant data.
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Timestamp DateTime The time (UTC) at which the event occurred.
1 EventType EventType The EventType of the access control event.
2 UnitGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access control unit involved in the event.
3 DeviceGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Device (Reader, InputDevice etc...) involved in the event.
4 APGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point (DoorSide etc...) involved in the event.
5 SourceGuid Guid The Guid of the source entity (DoorSide, Door, Area)
6 CredentialGuid Guid The unique identifier of the primary Credential involved in the event.
7 CardholderGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Cardholder involved in the event.
8 Credential2Guid Guid The unique identifier of the second Credential involved in the event.
9 TimeZone string The standard name of the Timezone in which the event occurred.
10 OccurrencePeriod int The integer value of OfflinePeriodType during which the event took place.
11 AccessPointGroupGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point group (Door, Area etc...) involved in the event.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AccessControl.AccessControlUnitQuery.Units
member.summary:
Get the collection of guids representing the access control units queried.
If a guid that represents any other is used, the query may return no results.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AccessControl.AccessControlReportQuery
member.summary: Abstract class used for AccessControl queries.
member.remarks: The is the common base class for all access control report queries in the Sdk.

Depending on the specific type of access control query being performed, different columns in the resulting will contain relevant data.
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Timestamp DateTime The time (UTC) at which the event occurred.
1 EventType EventType The EventType of the access control event.
2 UnitGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access control unit involved in the event.
3 DeviceGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Device (Reader, InputDevice etc...) involved in the event.
4 APGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point (DoorSide etc...) involved in the event.
5 SourceGuid Guid The Guid of the source entity (DoorSide, Door, Area)
6 CredentialGuid Guid The unique identifier of the primary Credential involved in the event.
7 CardholderGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Cardholder involved in the event.
8 Credential2Guid Guid The unique identifier of the second Credential involved in the event.
9 TimeZone string The standard name of the Timezone in which the event occurred.
10 OccurrencePeriod int The integer value of OfflinePeriodType during which the event took place.
11 AccessPointGroupGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point group (Door, Area etc...) involved in the event.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.ElevatorActivityQuery.Elevators
member.summary: Get the collection of guids representing elevators queried.

remarks.para: If the guid that represents a entity is used, then all elevator entities attached to the area will be queried.
If the guid that represents the entity is used, then all elevator entities in the system will be queried.
If a guid that represents any other is used, the query may return no results.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.ActivityTrailsQuery
member.summary: Class to query activity trails

remarks.para: The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: Guid of the initiator of the activity.
Name of the initiator of the activity.
Type of the initiator of the activity (corresponds to EntityType Enum).
Type Name of the initiator of the activity (EntityType Enum value).
Version of the initiator of the activity (if applicable, remains empty otherwise).
Type of activity (correspondonds to ActivityType Enum).
Activity type name (based on ActivityType Enum value).
Guid of the entity impacted by the activity.
Name of the entity impacted by the activity.
Type of the entity impacted by the activity (corresponds to EntityType Enum).
Type name of entity impacted by the activity (based on EntityType Enum value).
Application Type that initiated the activity (corresponds to ApplicationType Enum).
Application Name that initiated the activity (based on ApplicationType Enum value).
Version of the application that initiated activity (if applicable, remains empty otherwise).
Timestamp when the activity occured (DateTime in UTC).

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.IntrusionDetection.IntrusionUnitQuery
member.summary: Class to query intrusion unit activity. It reports on events that occur on the specified intrusion units such as AC fail, battery fail, unit lost, among others.
member.remarks: See for the fields returned in this report.

Depending on the specific type of access control query being performed, different columns in the resulting will contain relevant data.
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Timestamp DateTime The Utc Timestamp for the Event.
1 EventType int The EventType that was fired.
2 IntrusionUnitId Guid The guid for the IntrusionUnit involved in the event.
3 IntrusionAreaId Guid The guid for the IntrusionArea involved in the event.
4 DeviceId Guid The guid for the Device involved in the event.
5 SourceGuid Guid The guid for the Source entity for the event.
6 OccurencePeriod int The OfflinePeriodType enum.
7 TimeZoneId string The string representing the source time zone.
8 UserId Guid The guid for the User involved in the event.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.IntrusionDetection.IntrusionUnitQuery.IntrusionUnits
member.summary: Get the collection of guids representing the intrusion units queried.

remarks.para: If a guid that represents any other is used, the query may return no results.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AuditTrailQuery
member.summary: Class to query audit trails on entities. This query does not support custom field filtering please refer to remarks for further information.

remarks.para: The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The Guid of the entity being audited.
The Guid of the entity that modified the audited entity.
The Guid of the application entity that modified the audited entity. This can be Config Tool, Security Desk, the SDK, etc.
The name of the audited entity.
The name of the entity that modified the audited entity.
The name of the application that did the modification.
The enum is of type ApplicationType.
The custom field id. This can be an empty Guid.
The custom field name. This can be empty.
The custom field value type. The enum is of type CustomFieldValueType.
The audit trail modification type. The enum is of type AuditTrailModificationType.
This represents the enum called EntityType. The value can be cast to an int and then cast to an EntityType.
Obsolete. Starting in SC 5.4, the value is always AuditTrailModificationSubTypes.None.

remarks.para:
Custom fields filtering only properly works on specific queries. Here is the list of queries that do not support custom fields filtering.
On these queries you will be able to add filters in the custom field list but they will not affect your query and may lead to other error.

tr.th: Query classes not supporting custom fields filtering

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.IncidentSdkQuery
member.summary: Class to query incident reports. This query does not support custom field filtering please refer to remarks for further information.

remarks.para: The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The unique identifier of the incident.
The unique identifier of the IncidentTemplate. Generally, this is Guid.Empty when there is no template applied.
An XML string that represents the incident. It contains the information regarding the FormattedText, the language, the source guid, etc.
The description field of the incident.
The unique identifier of the user that created the incident.
The unique identifier of the user that modified the incident. When an incident is created, this field is generally the same as the user that created the incident.
An XML string that represents the entities that are attached as reference to this incident.
The DateTime (UTC) creation of the incident. This is the time saved when the user clicks on the Create Button.
The DateTime (UTC) of the modification of the incident.
The unique Id of the alarm responsible of the incident.
The EventType responsible of the incident.
The DateTime (UTC) the incident initially got created. This happens as soon as the Alarm is ackowledged.
An XML string that represents the attached video sequence to the incident

remarks.para:
Custom fields filtering only properly works on specific queries. Here is the list of queries that do not support custom fields filtering.
On these queries you will be able to add filters in the custom field list but they will not affect your query and may lead to other error.

tr.th: Query classes not supporting custom fields filtering

The XMLData column of the results contains the security level of the user who blocked the camera (UserLevel) and at which level the camera was blocked (BlockLevel). Even though unlikely, the xml format could change in a future release.
The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The unique identifier of the Camera.
The unique identifier of the source archiver.
The EventType. This value can be cast to .
The Capabilities. This is for internal use only.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.Video.VideoFileQuery
member.summary: Class to query video files.

remarks.para: The filter is used to specify a lower and upper bound to the archives. It includes any archive that span over the TimeRange lower bound, plus any subsequent archive that end before the TimeRange uppper bound.
The filter specifies an upper limit to the archive file start time. All files that start between the lower bound of and SecondStartTime, and end before the upper bound of will be returned.

To query for any archive that intersects a specified range (from t_start to t_end), specify t_start and DateTime.Max in the TimeRange, and t_end as the filter. This will return all the files that contain video in the specified range.
Use UTC times.
The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The unique identifier of the source archiver.
The file path on the hard disk.
The file path of the metadata.
The video protection state. The enum is of type VideoProtectionState.
True is the protection is infinite, otherwise false.
The hard drive location (C:\, D:\, etc).
The date at which the protection ends (UTC).

The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 CameraGuid Guid The unique identifier of the camera.
1 ArchiveSourceGuid Guid Unsupported, internal use only. The unique identifier of the Archiver Agent entity.
2 StartTime DateTime The start time (UTC) at which the event occurred.
3 EndTime DateTime The end time (UTC) at which the event occurred.
4 Capabilities uint Unsupported, internal use only.
5 TimeZone string The timezone.
6 EncoderGuid Guid The unique identifier of the .
7 UsageGuid Guid Unsupported, internal use only. The stream usage (StreamingType).
8 OriginGuid Guid Unsupported, internal use only. The unique identifier of the origin.
9 MediaTypeGuid Guid Unsupported, internal use only. The media type (StreamingType).
10 OriginType int Unsupported, internal use only. The origin type.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.PointOfSale.TransactionDetailsQuery
member.summary: Class to query the transaction details of a point of sale system.

remarks.para: Transaction detail query returns as result a data set of two tables in the query result. The first table is the transaction summary details. The second table contains each items of the transaction.
For the Data table

tr.td: The unique identifier of the transaction detail.
The terminal number. This can return 0.
The searched keyword. This can return empty.
The unique identifier of the cash register.
The transaction id. This is the same as the TransactionNumber.
the terminal id. This is the same as the TerminalNumber.

remarks.para: For the TransactionItemsDataTable table

tr.td: The description of the transaction item.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AreaActivityQuery
member.summary: Class to query an area for activity
member.remarks:
Depending on the specific type of access control query being performed, different columns in the resulting will contain relevant data.
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Timestamp DateTime The time (UTC) at which the event occurred.
1 EventType EventType The EventType of the access control event.
2 UnitGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access control unit involved in the event.
3 DeviceGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Device (Reader, InputDevice etc...) involved in the event.
4 APGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point (DoorSide etc...) involved in the event.
5 SourceGuid Guid The Guid of the source entity (DoorSide, Door, Area)
6 CredentialGuid Guid The unique identifier of the primary Credential involved in the event.
7 CardholderGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Cardholder involved in the event.
8 Credential2Guid Guid The unique identifier of the second Credential involved in the event.
9 TimeZone string The standard name of the Timezone in which the event occurred.
10 OccurrencePeriod int The integer value of OfflinePeriodType during which the event took place.
11 AccessPointGroupGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point group (Door, Area etc...) involved in the event.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AreaActivityQuery.Areas
member.summary: Get the collection of guids representing areas queried.

remarks.para: If the guid that represents the entity is used, then all area entities in the system will be queried.
If a guid that represents any other is used, the query may return no results.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.AlarmActivityQuery
member.summary: Queries the Directory for alarm activity. This query does not support custom field filtering please refer to remarks for further information.

remarks.para: Use the to query for alarms.

Alarm activity query returns as result a data set of two extra tables in the query result. The first extra table is the dynamic attached entities. The second extra table is the dynamic Urls. The link between the two extra tables and the main table is the alarm InstanceID.
The returned from the query has the following schema:

tr.td: The unique identifier of this alarm instance
Source entity guid that generated the alarm (ex: a user)
Source event of the origin of the trigger (ex: manual action )
Time (UTC) at which the alarm was triggered in SecurityCenter
Time (UTC) at which the alarm was acked ( DateTime.MinValue if not acked )
Who acked the alarm, Guid.Empty if not acked
Time at which the alarm was created. TriggerTime != CreationTime when the alarm was created in a third party system but was actually triggered in SC only X time afterward.
The OfflinePeriodType during which the event took place.
External instance ID (for a federated alarm).
Who investigated the alarm, Guid.Empty if no investigation has been made
Time (UTC) at wich the alarm was investigated (DateTime.MinValue if never investigated)
State of the alarm (see AlarmState enumeration)
The has source condition column name.

remarks.para:
Custom fields filtering only properly works on specific queries. Here is the list of queries that do not support custom fields filtering.
On these queries you will be able to add filters in the custom field list but they will not affect your query and may lead to other error.

tr.th: Query classes not supporting custom fields filtering

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.DoorActivityQuery
member.summary: Class to query door activity
member.remarks:
Depending on the specific type of access control query being performed, different columns in the resulting will contain relevant data.
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Timestamp DateTime The time (UTC) at which the event occurred.
1 EventType EventType The EventType of the access control event.
2 UnitGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access control unit involved in the event.
3 DeviceGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Device (Reader, InputDevice etc...) involved in the event.
4 APGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point (DoorSide etc...) involved in the event.
5 SourceGuid Guid The Guid of the source entity (DoorSide, Door, Area)
6 CredentialGuid Guid The unique identifier of the primary Credential involved in the event.
7 CardholderGuid Guid The unique identifier of the Cardholder involved in the event.
8 Credential2Guid Guid The unique identifier of the second Credential involved in the event.
9 TimeZone string The standard name of the Timezone in which the event occurred.
10 OccurrencePeriod int The integer value of OfflinePeriodType during which the event took place.
11 AccessPointGroupGuid Guid The unique identifier of the access point group (Door, Area etc...) involved in the event.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.DoorActivityQuery.Doors
member.summary: Get the collection of guids representing doors queried.

remarks.para: If the guid that represents a entity is used, then all door entities attached to the area will be queried.
If the guid that represents the entity is used, then all door entities in the system will be queried.
If a guid that represents any other is used, the query may return no results.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Queries.EntityConfigurationQuery
member.summary: Queries the Directory for entities and downloads them locally.
member.remarks:
Use this class to query for entities and populate the Engine's entity cache. It is not recommended to use the dataset returned by this query directly. Instead one should obtain the objects that were downloaded through the method
The returned from the query has the following schema:
Column # Name Type Description
0 Guid System.Guid The unique identifier of the entity

member.remarks: If this property is set to true it is possible that results not matching the search criteria will be included in the dataset. If you wish to avoid this you must also set the property to true. The guids of the related entities will still be downloaded but any extra things like their name won't be.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.EventsArgs.OfflineSynchronizationEventArgs
member.summary: OfflineSynchronizationEventArgs class
member.remarks:
This class implements the event data for all offline unit synchronization events.
There are three different possible offline unit synchronization event types:
OfflineSynchronizationStarted, fired at the start of an offline unit synchronization.
OfflineSynchronizationSuccess, fired after a successful offline unit synchronization.
OfflineSynchronizationFailure, fired after a failed offline unit synchronization.
All three event types are represented in the property.

member.value: An value representing the state of the offline unit synchronization.

Remember that every DateTime sent in a table should be of type UTC, because this is how they are interpreted in the backend.
member.remarks: The for this field must be set to If you have a unit in the report query, the Timezone will be overwritten by it. The Dates will be adjusted to the given timezone, but on the report, the timezone will be shown as the unit timezone.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.AccessVerifier.GetAccessResults(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.DateTime,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the access results for each side or direction of the specified access point groups. Important notes: antipassback is not taken into account. timezone and dual credential related information is obtianed from the reader. If there is no reader the timezone is assumed to be local to the machine and the secondary credential parameter is not validated.
member.param: guids representing access points or access point groups
the utc time at which the read takes place
the main credential involved in the read
optionally, the second credential involved in the read
optionally the reader device guid (Not used for doors or elevator floors that have readers assigned.)
member.returns: a lazy collection of results for each access point. (ie any groups in the input will get expanded)

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.DisplayInTile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Displays content in the Security Desk, specifying the Monitor Id as the destination.
member.param: The tile in which the content should be displayed.
The content to be displayed (in the XML format).

remarks.para: This method has multiple overloads. The tileId is used to specify which tile should display the content. When not specified, the content will be displayed in the first empty tile.

The forceDisplay value is used to control whether the Security Desk changes the active page to display the content. Having forceDisplay false is equivalent to not specifying it. Having forceDisplay true will have an effect when the active page doesn't contain tiles, or when the requested tileId is higher than the number of tiles in the active page. In this case, the Security Desk will find the first opened Monitoring page with enough tiles, or open a new Monitoring page, then display the xmlContent in that page.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.DisplayInTile(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)

member.param: The tile in which the content should be displayed.

member.remarks: This method triggers the process of offline synchronization for a given entity. When calling for the synchronization of an access contol unit specify the access control unit`s Guid as the recipient. Note that the access manager will refuse manual offline synchronization for an access control unit if synchronization is configured in automatic mode. Use StartOfflineSynchronization with the forced parameter instead.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.StartRecording(System.Guid,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Triggers video recording for the specified .
member.param: A indicating the desired recording duration.
The unique identifier of the camera to start recording on.
member.remarks:
Calling this method immediately triggers video recording for the specified duration. The associated with the request is and will appear as such in the and related archive event reports. Note that if the configured for the is the request will be ignored.
All recording requests are treated in a layered fashion. For example, if a user requests manual recording with a default manual recording length of 5 minutes and an external Sdk request is made 1 minute later for 5 minutes, the archiver will record for a total of 6 minutes. Requests are also treated by priority. For example, if a user issues a manual request as in the example above and an external request is received, the user will be unable to stop manual recording until the duration associated with external request has elapsed. Recording triggered by an alarm or an external request will take priority over recording triggered by motion or manual requests.
member.exception: The specified camera guid could not be retreived.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.StartRecording(System.Guid,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triggers video recording for the specified .
member.param: The unique identifier of the camera to start recording on.
A indicating the desired recording duration.
Boolean value indicating if the recording state should be LockedOn or On when recording.
member.remarks:
Note that if the configured for the is the request will be ignored.
All recording requests are treated in a layered fashion. For example, if a user requests manual recording with a default manual recording length of 5 minutes and an external Sdk request is made 1 minute later for 5 minutes, the archiver will record for a total of 6 minutes. Requests are also treated by priority. For example, if a user issues a manual request as in the example above and an external request is received, the user will be unable to stop manual recording until the duration associated with external request has elapsed. Recording triggered by an alarm or an external request will take priority over recording triggered by motion or manual requests.
member.exception: The specified camera guid could not be retreived.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.AddVideoProtection(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Protects video sequences associated with list of cameras.
member.param: The start time of the sequence to protect expressed in UTC.
The end time of the sequence to protect expressed in UTC.
The duration for which the video should be protected. For example, the next 5 days.
member.remarks: Use this method to protect one or more archived video sequences from deletion. The minimum duration is 1 day. Protection is applied immediately to any archived sequences that fit within span indicated. The sequences will remain protected for the specified duration. When protection ends the sequences will be deleted subject to archiver role's automatic cleanup schedule. Specifying a duration of will protect the specified span indefinitely. To remove protection from a video sequence use .
member.exception: Either of the DateTime values specified is DateTimeKind.Unspecified.
The specified start time is after the specified end time.
The specified end time is in the future.
The specified duration is less than 1 day.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.RemoveVideoProtection(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Removes protection from video sequences associated with list of cameras.
member.param: List of cameras to remove protection from.
The start time of the sequence to protect expressed in UTC.
The end time of the sequence to protect expressed in UTC.
The duration for which the video should be protected. For example, the next 5 days.
member.remarks: Protection of video files in not immediately removed. As a security measure, the video sequence remains protected for 24 hours before protection is finally dropped. Following this, the video will eventually be deleted subject to the archiver role's automatic cleanup schedule.
member.exception: Either of the DateTime values specified is DateTimeKind.Unspecified.
The specified start time is after the specified end time.
The specified end time is in the future.
The specified duration is less than 1 day.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ActionManager.RaiseEvent(Genetec.Sdk.Events.Event)
member.summary: Throws an event in the system
member.remarks:
Manually builded and raise by this method may not be persisted in the system. To be sure about the persistance of the event trigger an event using the appropriate trigger method.
When using a CustomEvent, the event has to be cast to a .
This method allows the owner of an entity to raise events on it, i.e., AccessManager can raise events on a door, Archiver can raise events on a camera and so on. Since a SDK application does not own the entities, it can only raise custom events on them.
member.exception: You only have read access on this member since it is an entity that you do not own.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.EventTransaction
member.summary: Represents an Event Transaction in the system.
member.remarks:
Event transactions are used to group events together so that they are sent to the directory as a single request rather than one at a time. This can help with scalability in situations where many events need to be sent. Note that you can start many event transactions in parallel since they each have their own context.
implements . Disposing the transaction has the same effect as commiting it. This means that you can put your transaction in a using statement and then add events to it inside that statement and the transaction will automatically be commited when exiting that scope. Events can be added to transactions in 2 ways.
1. You can call on the transaction.
2. You can call on the .
Both of these methods are identical. When you want to commit your transaction there are 3 alternatives.
1. You dispose the EventTransaction (either manually or through a using statement)
2. You call on the transaction.
3. You call on the .

example.para: Below is a sample method that builds events of specified types and fires them on the same source entity as a single transaction.

member.summary: Adds an event to the specified event transaction.
member.remarks: Event transactions are used to group events together so that they are sent to the directory as a single request rather than one at a time. This can help with scalability in situations where many events need to be sent. Note that you can start many event transactions in parallel since they each have their own context.
member.returns: true if the event was succesfully added. false if the transaction does not exist, was already commited, or if the add resulted in an error.

member.summary: Ends the event transaction sending all events added to it to the directory.
member.remarks: Event transactions are used to group events together so that they are sent to the directory as a single request rather than one at a time. This can help with scalability in situations where many events need to be sent. Note that you can start many event transactions in parallel since they each have their own context.
member.exception: If the sdk is not connected to a server
member.returns: True if the transaction was succesfully commited and the events added to it sent to the directory. False if the transaction was empty, already commited, or resulted in an error.

member.returns: A object representing the report to query.
member.remarks: This overload may be called when you want the option of specifying that the for the query be interpreted as client local time rather than device local time. If you wish to query using client local time the value of sourceTimeZone should be null. If you wish to query using device local time, provide the TimeZoneInfo.Local of the client performing the query. The value will be used to recover client local time when the query is processed on the server.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ReportManager.SendQueryCompleted(System.Int32,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Boolean,Genetec.Sdk.ReportError,System.String)
member.summary: Used by a query server (a plugin) to indicate that the specified request has been completed.
member.param: The MessageId property from the event argument.
The QuerySource property from the event argument.
The unique identifier of the plugin that processed the request.
Trueif processing was successful. Otherwise, false
A indicating the error if the successful parameter is set to false. See the enumeration for additional information.
A indicating a detailed error message to be displayed to the user if the successful parameter is set to false.
member.remarks:
Use this method to indicate to the client that the processing of a has been completed and there are no more results to send. This method is used on conjunction with the method to handle query requests coming in from the event.
The messageId and querySource parameters are both necessary to accurately indicate which query coming from which client has been completed. The two values may be taken from the object.
A note to plugin developers. The event does not filter requests using supported report query types. Override the OnQueryReceived method in the base Plugin class instead of the ReportQueryReceived event to receieve query requests.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ReportManager.SendQueryCompleted(System.Int32,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Boolean,Genetec.Sdk.ReportError,Genetec.Sdk.Severity,System.String)
member.summary: Used by a query server (a plugin) to indicate that the specified request has been completed.
member.param: The MessageId property from the event argument.
The QuerySource property from the event argument.
The unique identifier of the plugin that processed the request.
Trueif processing was successful. Otherwise, false
A indicating the error if the successful parameter is set to false. See the enumeration for additional information.
A to indicate the severity of the error if the successful parameter is set to false.
A indicating a detailed error message to be displayed to the user if the successful parameter is set to false.
member.remarks:
Use this method to indicate to the client that the processing of a has been completed and there are no more results to send. This method is used on conjunction with the method to handle query requests coming in from the event.
The messageId and querySource parameters are both necessary to accurately indicate which query coming from which client has been completed. The two values may be taken from the object.
A note to plugin developers. The event does not filter requests using supported report query types. Override the OnQueryReceived method in the base Plugin class instead of the ReportQueryReceived event to receieve query requests.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.ReportManager.SendQueryResult(System.Int32,Genetec.Sdk.Queries.ReportQueryResults)
member.summary: Used by a query server (a plugin) to return the results of a request.
member.param: The MessageId property from the event argument.
A object containing the results of the query.
member.remarks:
Use this method one or more times during the execution of a request to return query results to a client. This method should be called one or more times while the query is in execution to return results and then followed by a call to the when processing has been completed. You must call this method at least once.
To correctly return results to the appropriate client be sure to set the uniqueId parameter as well as the parameter of the object.
A note to plugin developers. The event does not filter requests using supported report query types. Override the OnQueryReceived method in the base Plugin class instead of the ReportQueryReceived event to receieve query requests.
member.exception: If the queryResult parameter is null.
If the QuerySource property of the queryResult parameter is not set.
If there is no pending report query for the specified queryResult and uniqueId parameter.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.RequestManager.AddRequestHandler``2(System.Action{``0,Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.RequestCompletion{``1}})
member.summary: Add a handler that will process the specified request type.
member.param: The handler that will process the request.

remarks.para: This mecanism allows communication between different SDK applications or modules. The 'server' registers its request handler. The 'client' sends requests. The TRequest and TResponse classes must be serializable (these classes must be public, marked with the ). Both the client and server must refer to the same class in the same assembly, or the classes must have the same name, namespace and members.
The handler is invoked on a background thread, not the main thread.

member.summary: Class used to check what privileges are granted to the logged on user.

member.summary: Gets the internal Directory proxy

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.SecurityManager.IsPrivilegeGranted(System.Guid)
member.summary: Indicates if the logged on user has a specific privilege.
member.returns: True if the privilege is granted. False, if it is denied or undefined.
member.remarks: Use the object to get the guid of the privilege.

example.code: var canModifyAlarms = _engine.SecurityManager.IsPrivilegeGranted(SdkPrivilege.ModifyAlarms);

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.SecurityManager.IsPrivilegeGranted(System.Guid,System.Guid)
member.summary: Indicates if the logged on user has a specific privilege on a specific entity.
member.param: The unique identifier of the privileged entity to which the specified user wants access.
member.returns: True if the privilege is granted. False, if the privilege is denied or undefined or if the logged user does not have access to the partition that has the entity.

remarks.para: Use the object to get the guid of the privilege.

Note that if the entity is under a different partition than the default one and the logged on user is not an accepted member of this partition (or its parents), this method will return false regardless of whether the user has the correct privilege.

Note that if the logged on user belongs to an usergroup that has access to the partition (or the partition's parents) where the entity is held but does not himself have access to the partition AND has the correct privilege, this method will return true.

example.code: var canModifyAlarms = _engine.SecurityManager.IsPrivilegeGranted(SdkPrivilege.ModifyAlarms, alarmGuid);

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.SecurityManager.IsPrivilegeGranted(System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Guid)
member.summary: Indicates if the specified user or usergroup has a specific privilege on a specific entity
member.param: The unique identifier of the user or usergroup associated with the privilege request.
The unique identifier of the privileged entity to which the specified user wants access.
member.returns: True if the privilege is granted and the user/usergroup has access to the partition where the entity is held. False, if it is denied or undefined

remarks.para: Use the object to get the guid of the privilege.

The entity parameter refers to the entity you want to verify whether the user has access to, that is, to check whether the specified user has the permission to access the partition where the entity is held.
To check whether an user has a basic privilege, for example, if the user can modify cameras without specifying an entity, you can just pass the value of Guid.Empty to the entity parameter.

Note that if the entity is under a different partition than the default one and the user (or its parent usergroup) is not an accepted member of this partition (or its parents), this method will return false regardless of whether the user has the correct privilege.

Note that if the user belongs to an usergroup that has access to the partition (or the partition's parents) where the entity is held but does not himself have access to the partition AND the user itself has the correct privilege, this method will return true.
Note that if the user guid passed corresponds to the admin user, the administrator usergroup or is in the administrator usergroup, it will return true.

Note that for a recently created user whose privileges have never been modified who is part of an usergroup, this method will evaluate the partition access and the usergroup privileges as well regardless of the privilege state value being Undefined.

example.code: var canModifyAlarms = _engine.SecurityManager.IsPrivilegeGranted(SdkPrivilege.ModifyAlarms, userGuid, alarmGuid);

member.summary: Gets the internal sync update.
member.remarks: This SynchUpdate is used internally in cases where we need to lock on a resource but we don't want the warnings and asserts. Use it only when appropriate.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.AddEventToTransaction(Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.EventTransaction,Genetec.Sdk.Events.Event)
member.summary: Adds an event to the specified event transaction.
member.remarks: Event transactions are used to group events together so that they are sent to the directory as a single request rather than one at a time. This can help with scalability in situations where many events need to be sent. Note that you can start many event transactions in parallel since they each have their own context. Once you are ready to fire the events you have added to your transaction use the method and provide your transaction.
member.param: The transaction to add the event to.
member.returns: true if the event was succesfully added. false if the transaction does not exist, was already commited, or if the add resulted in an error.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.CommitEventTransaction(Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.EventTransaction)
member.summary: Ends the event transaction associated to the Id parameter sending all events added to it since the call.
member.remarks: Event transactions are used to group events together so that they are sent to the directory as a single request rather than one at a time. This can help with scalability in situations where many events need to be sent. Note that you can start many event transactions in parallel since they each have their own context.
member.exception: If the sdk is not connected to a server
member.returns: True if the transaction was succesfully commited and the events added to it sent to the directory. False if the transaction was empty, already commited, or resulted in an error.

member.summary: Sends to the server all entity modifications

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.CommitTransaction(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends to the server all entity modifications
member.param: If true, transaction will automatically rollback on failure. Default value is true.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.CreateEventTransaction
member.summary: Creates a new event transaction and returns the transaction Id.
member.remarks: Event transactions are used to group events together so that they are sent to the directory as a single request rather than one at a time. This can help with scalability in situations where many events need to be sent. Note that you can start many event transactions in parallel since they each have their own context. Once you are ready to fire the events you have added to your transaction use the method and provide your transaction id.
member.returns: The transaction Id for this transaction

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.CreateTransaction
member.summary: Starts a transaction
member.remarks: Execute any synchronous queries before creating a transaction, or after commiting a transaction. Executing a query synchronously using ReportQuery.Query() throws an exception if done inside a transaction that has pending updates (e.g. CreateTransaction(), update an entity, Query(), CommitTransaction()).

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.ExecuteTransaction``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Executes a transaction that return a result. This transaction will rollback if there is an exception that occured during the execution of the transaction. Also, this transaction will rollback if there is an exception during commit.
member.typeparam: The typename of the value that should be returned as the result of the transaction.
member.param: The transaction to execute and commit if successfull.
member.returns: The result of the transaction.
member.remarks: Important, do not execute CreateTransaction() and/or CommitTransaction() inside the , this method already does it.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Workflows.TransactionManager.ExecuteTransaction(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes a transaction that return no result. This transaction will rollback if there is an exception that occured during the execution of the transaction. Also, this transaction will rollback if there is an exception during commit.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat
member.summary: Represents various types of Audio codecs.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.None
member.summary: No Audio Format

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.Pcm
member.summary: Pulse-code modulation (PCM) is a method used to digitally represent sampled analog signals. It is the standard form for digital audio in computers and various Blu-ray, DVD and Compact Disc formats.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G711
member.summary: G.711 is an ITU-T standard for audio companding. It is required standard in many technologies, for example in H.320 and H.323 specifications.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.Gsm0610
member.summary: GSM 0610 codec has much lower traffic footprint (13 Kbit/sec in each direction) and can be used in low-bandwidth networks, but it creates more CPU load (for repackaging) and provides lower quality compared to G.711.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G721
member.summary: G.721 is an ITU-T ADPCM speech codec standard covering the transmission of voice at rates of 32 kbit/s.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G723_24
member.summary: G.723 is a ITU-T standard speech codec using extensions of G.721 providing voice quality covering 300 Hz to 3400 Hz using Adaptive Differential Pulse Code Modulation (ADPCM) to 24 kbit/s for digital circuit multiplication equipment (DCME) applications.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G723_40
member.summary: G.723 is a ITU-T standard speech codec using extensions of G.721 providing voice quality covering 300 Hz to 3400 Hz using Adaptive Differential Pulse Code Modulation (ADPCM) to 40 kbit/s for digital circuit multiplication equipment (DCME) applications.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G722
member.summary: The G.722 audio format is is a ITU-T standard 7 kHz wideband speech codec operating at 48, 56 and 64 kbit/s.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G728
member.summary: G.728 is an ITU-T standard for speech coding operating at 16 kbit/s. It is officially described as Coding of speech at 16 kbit/s using low-delay code excited linear prediction.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G723_1
member.summary: G.723.1 is an audio codec for voice that compresses voice audio in 30 ms frames. An algorithmic look-ahead of 7.5 ms duration means that total algorithmic delay is 37.5 ms. Its official name is Dual rate speech coder for multimedia communications transmitting at 5.3 and 6.3 kbit/s. Keep in mind that this is a completely different codec from G.723. There are two bit rates at which G.723.1 can operate: 6.3 kbit/s (using 24 byte frames) using a MPC-MLQ algorithm (MOS 3.9) 5.3 kbit/s (using 20 byte frames) using an ACELP algorithm (MOS 3.62)

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.G711_Verint
member.summary: Verint's particular flavour of the codec.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.Enumerations.AudioDataFormat.AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) is a standardized, lossy compression and encoding scheme for digital audio. AAC has been standardized by ISO and IEC, as part of the MPEG-2 and MPEG-4 specifications.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.BypassedState

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.BypassedState.Unknown

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.BypassedState.On

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.BypassedState.Off

member.summary: The intrusion area supports 'delayed perimeter arm'.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.TriggerIntrusionAlarm
member.summary: The intrusion area supports 'trigger intrusion alarm'.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.Disarm
member.summary: The intrusion area supports 'disarm'.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.CanConfigureArmingDelay
member.summary: The intrusion area supports an arming delay being specified when an arming command is sent. This delay will only be used with the associated command and not affect future arm requests. This capability implies different areas of the same unit can be simultaneously armed using different arming delays. This differs from the Unit Wide which sets a delay in the unit for all future non-instant arm requests.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.SilenceAlarm
member.summary: This Intrusion area supports silencing alarms (this does not disarm the area, nor does it acknowledge the alarm)

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.AcknowledgeAlarm
member.summary: This Intrusion area supports acknowledging alarms, (this does not disarm the area, it does however implicitly silence it.)

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.ForceArm
member.summary: The Intrusion area can be armed even if some inputs are active or trouble and not bypassed. (force arming an area should not autobypass the inputs, depending on the panel doing this might result in an alarm being raised immediately)

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.ChangeArmTypeWithoutDisarm
member.summary: The area supports switching directly between master and perimeter arm without passing through disarm.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.BypassArm
member.summary: The area can be armed even if some inputs are active or trouble and not bypassed by autobypassing the offending inputs

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.IntrusionAreaCapabilities.All
member.summary: The intrusion area supports all actions.

Use this enumeration with the Plugin.SupportedQueries property to declare what kinds of report your plug-in supports.

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.IEngine.EntityAdded
member.summary: Event called when an entity has been added
member.remarks:
In order to migrate easily from this version to the new event the simple approach is the following:
1. Update your event handler to take the new event args type:
2. iterate over the property of the event args in a foreach loop and put all of the old code of the method into the loop
the Entities property iterates items of type which contain the same information as the previous event args had.
Of course this way of migrating your code does NOT take advantage of the fact that you now get a collection of updates. A more custom update that uses the batch to improve performance of your handler is highly recommended.

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.IEngine.RequestDirectoryCertificateValidation
member.summary: Event called when a validation is needed to ensure the directory can be trusted
member.remarks:
Starting in 5.4, the communication to the Directory is encrypted and uses a TLS/SSL certificate: the Secure Communication Certificate. Refer to the Security Center documentation for more information on this feature. Once a Secure Communication Certificate is accepted by either an SDK application, the Security Desk or the Config Tool, the system doesn't prompt again for either of these The granularity is the combination of Windows user, computer and Secure Communication Certificate.
In other words, the event is called if the Secure Communication Certificate has not yet been accepted by this Windows user on this computer for the Secure Communication Certificate.
Note on usage:
- When this event handler is not used, the SDK application automatically accepts the Secure Communication Certificate.
- Hook onto this event before logon.
- The event argument contains the Secure Communication Certificate details and a property to accept or refuse it.
- If the user should accept the Secure Communication Certificate only by using the client applications (Security Desk, Config Tool), use a handler on this event and refuse the Secure Communication Certificate.
To test the usage of this feature during the development of an SDK application, it becomes necessary to remove communication certificates from the white-list. Files are stored under %localappdata%\Genetec Security Center 5.X\CertificateCache.
This mechanism secures the communication to the Directory, it is unrelated to the SDK certificate mechanism that controls which application can connect (e.g. , Certificate files).

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.IEngine.RegisterClientCertificate(System.String)
member.summary: Registers the specified client certificate with the directory and increments the license count associated with it by one.
member.param: The encrypted string containing the client certificate information.
member.exception: The client certificate parameter cannot be null.
The caller is not an application of type Plugin.

The client certificate could not be located on disk
or The client certificate on disk is invalid or corrupt.
or The specified certificate is not part of your Security Center license.
or The additional registration of the specified certificate exceeds the limit set by your Security Center license.
or The application ID in the specified certificate is invalid or corrupt.
member.remarks:
Note that this method can only be called by plugins.
Use this method to register additional client certificates with the directory. When the call is received, the license count associated with the certificate is incremented for the duration of the plugin's execution. All client certificates associated with the connection inlcuding the plugin itself are automatically unregistered on logoff when the plugin terminates.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.IEngine.GetEntities(Genetec.Sdk.EntityType)
member.summary: Retrieves cached entities of a specific type.
member.remarks: No query will be sent to the directory as a result of this call. The main purpose of this method is to retrieve entity objects after having used an to prefetch the data needed from the directory. Despite returning only cached entities it is possible that only part of these entities properties are currently cached. This means that accessing certain properties on some of the objects returned by this method might trigger additional queries. If this is not your intention make sure that your prefetch query retrieves all of the necessary information.
member.returns: List of entities of the provided type that are currently in the local cache

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Incidents.TileIncidentRecording.#ctor
member.summary: Use this constructor to build up new tile recording. Access the "tile recording" attachement of an incident. The tile recording is a subset of specific ranges for different cameras that was recorded and can be replayed. This class allows to replay the incident, and provide access to the TileRecorder that is able to edit/add the sequences to the tile recording.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.MediaUrl
member.summary: This class has the responsibility to provide the mean to build URLs for camera entities depending on their version. This is used to bridge the version independant SDK to a version dependant entity.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.MediaUrl.BuildAudioInUrl(Genetec.Sdk.Engine,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Builds a media url from en entity guid. The requested stream type will be the default value (live)
member.param: If set to true, will return a live stream url
member.returns: A version independant URL to be used by the MediaPlayer

member.summary: Builds a media url from en entity guid. The requested stream type will be the default value (live)
member.returns: A version independant URL to be used by the MediaPlayer

member.summary: Build the metadata urls of this camera
member.param: The subnet id from where the stream is requested
If set to true, will return a live stream url
member.returns: A version independant URL to be used by the MediaPlayer

member.summary: This method called when new block of data is ready

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.ReportQueryCancelledEventArgs
member.summary: For use by plugins only. Encapsulates the parameters associated with a ReportQueryCancelled event.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.ReportQueryCancelledEventArgs.MessageId
member.summary: Gets the message identifier associated with the initial query request.
member.remarks: The message identifier is not unique accross multiple clients. When locating the query request to cancel, be sure to use both the message identifier and the query identifier.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.ReportQueryCancelledEventArgs.QueryId
member.summary: Gets the query identifier associated with the initial query request.
member.remarks: Use this identifier to locate the query to be cancelled by matching it up with the property of the initial query request.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.ReportQueryCancelledEventArgs.SystemsToCancel
member.summary: Gets the Guids of the external systems to cancel the query for.
member.remarks: The enumerable contains the uniqudentifiers of the set of external systems for which this query should be cancelled. It is used by the directory when re-directing queries to roles.

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.ReportQueryCancelledEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.SdkPrivilege.AddDeleteSchedules
member.summary:
OBSOLETE - Allows the user to create or delete schedules.
This privilege has been split into two different privileges, AddSchedules and DeleteSchedules. This legacy value can only be used with the IsPrivilegeGranted methods of the SecurityManager class and that is equivalent to checking for both the Add and Delete privileges.

member.summary: User macro derivate with overrided ApplicationDomain and PermissionSet properties

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Scripting.UserMacroWithSetup.ApplicationDomain
member.summary: Gets the application domain friendly name. This value is not set by user code, but rather configured manually on the macro entity, under the Default execution context.
member.remarks: All macros that have the same ApplicationDomain value run inside the same app domain. By default, all macros have the same ApplicationDomain. A single SDK Engine is instanciated per application domain, shared by all macros in that domain. Use this property to configure a macro to run in a specific application domain.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Scripting.UserMacroWithSetup.PermissionSet
member.summary: Gets the macro's permission set. This value is not set by user code, but rather configured manually on the macro entity, under the Default execution context.

member.name: P:Genetec.Sdk.Engine.PreventDirectoryRedirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Engine should prevent the Directory redirection.
member.value: true to prevent the Directory redirection; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property is useful to bypass the load balancing server redirection.
This property is set to false by default and the Directory Manager redirects the connection requests across all Directory servers in a round robin fashion.
To prevent the load balancing server redirection, set this property to true before logging on
By registering to the event, the has the property that contains the server name to which the engine is connected.

example.code: m_engine.PreventDirectoryRedirection = true; m_engine.BeginLogOn("specificServer", "admin", "password");

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.Engine.EntityAdded
member.summary: Event called when an entity has been added to the local cache.
member.remarks:
In order to migrate easily from this version to the new event the simple approach is the following:
1. Update your event handler to take the new event args type:
2. Iterate over the property of the event args in a foreach loop and put all of the old code of the method into the loop
3. If the Event handler uses any component from the UI, it will be necessary to Invoke the changes with the Dispatcher. The event is always raised in the background. This event is raised on the UI thread when possible.
the Entities property iterates items of type which contain the same information as the previous event args had.
Of course this way of migrating your code does NOT take advantage of the fact that you now get a collection of updates. A more custom update that uses the batch to improve performance of your handler is highly recommended.

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.Engine.RequestDirectoryCertificateValidation
member.summary: Event called when a validation is needed to ensure the Directory can be trusted
member.remarks:
Starting in 5.4, the communication to the Directory is encrypted and uses a TLS/SSL certificate: the Secure Communication Certificate. Refer to the Security Center documentation for more information on this feature. Once a Secure Communication Certificate is accepted by either an SDK application, the Security Desk or the Config Tool, the system doesn't prompt again for either of these. The granularity is the combination of Windows user, computer and Secure Communication Certificate.
In other words, the event is called if the Secure Communication Certificate has not yet been accepted by this Windows user on this computer for the Secure Communication Certificate.
Note on usage:
- When this event handler is not used, the SDK application can connect (for backward compatibility). This does not white-list the certificate.
- Register to this event before logon.
- The event argument contains the Secure Communication Certificate details and a property to accept or refuse it.
- If the user should accept the Secure Communication Certificate only by using the client applications (Security Desk, Config Tool), use a handler on this event and refuse the Secure Communication Certificate.
To test the usage of this feature during the development of an SDK application, it becomes necessary to remove communication certificates from the white-list. Files are stored under %localappdata%\Genetec Security Center 5.X\CertificateCache.
This mechanism secures the communication to the Directory, it is unrelated to the SDK certificate mechanism that controls which application can connect (e.g. , Certificate files).

The password to use for login

remarks.para: To logon using a user from a specific domain from an Active Directory integration, specify the domain in username. Use the User Principal Name format (e.g. johnDoe@domain.com) or the Down-Level Logon Name format (e.g. domain\johnDoe). See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa380525(v=vs.85).aspx.
To logon using the credentials of the Windows user running the process, use .

member.param: The username to use for login
The password to use for login
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: if the logon succeeded, or the corresponding error otherwise.Additional error codes may be added in future versions of the SDK. Any return value different than should be considered a logon failure.

remarks.para: To logon using a user from a specific domain from an Active Directory integration, specify the domain in username. Use the User Principal Name format (e.g. johnDoe@domain.com) or the Down-Level Logon Name format (e.g. domain\johnDoe). See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa380525(v=vs.85).aspx.
To logon using the credentials of the Windows user running the process, use .

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Engine.GetEntities(Genetec.Sdk.EntityType)
member.summary: Retrieves cached entities of a specific type.
member.remarks: No query will be sent to the Directory as a result of this call. The main purpose of this method is to retrieve entity objects after having used an to prefetch the data needed from the Directory. Despite returning only cached entities it is possible that only part of these entities properties are currently cached. This means that accessing certain properties on some of the objects returned by this method might trigger additional queries. If this is not your intention make sure that your prefetch query retrieves all of the necessary information.
member.returns: List of entities of the provided type that are currently in the local cache

member.name: M:Genetec.Sdk.Engine.RegisterClientCertificate(System.String)
member.summary: Registers the specified client certificate with the Directory and increments the license count associated with it by one.
member.param: The encrypted string containing the client certificate information.
member.exception: The client certificate parameter cannot be null.
The caller is not an application of type Plugin.

The client certificate could not be located on disk
or The client certificate on disk is invalid or corrupt.
or The specified certificate is not part of your Security Center license.
or The additional registration of the specified certificate exceeds the limit set by your Security Center license.
or The application ID in the specified certificate is invalid or corrupt.
member.remarks:
Note that this method can only be called by plugins.
Use this method to register additional client certificates with the Directory. When the call is received, the license count associated with the certificate is incremented for the duration of the plugin's execution. All client certificates associated with the connection inlcuding the plugin itself are automatically unregistered on logoff when the plugin terminates.

member.summary: The specified camera signal state is currently unknown. See for more information.

member.summary: The specified camera is experiencing a loss of signal.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult
member.summary: Enumerates the result of adding a video unit.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.Connecting
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has started.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.Added
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has been added successful.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.AlreadyAdded
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because it has already been added to this archiver.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.AlreadyExistingElsewhere
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because it has already been added to a different archiver.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.Timeout
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has timed out.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.BadLogin
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed due to invalid credentials.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.LicenseError
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video has failed due to licensing.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.DiscoveryError
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed due to a discovery error.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.VideoDecoderNotSupported
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the video decoder is not supported.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.BadSettings
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because of bad settings.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.UnexpectedError
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because of an unexpected error.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.NoAgentRunning
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because there is no archiver is running.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.InvalidDiscoveryPort
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the discovery port was invalid.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.InvalidExtensionType
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because of an invalid extension type.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.NoDiscoveryPort
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because no discovery port was specified.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.NoDriver
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the driver for the unit could not be loaded.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.NoExtension
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the extension associated with this unit could not be created.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.MaxConnectionReached
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because there are no more connections available for the unit.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.CantConnect
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the archiver is unable to connect to the unit with the information specified.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.BadRequest
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the unit issued a bad request error.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.InvalidAuthentication
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the unit is using a forbidden authentication scheme.

member.name: F:Genetec.Sdk.EnrollmentResult.SslCertificateError
member.summary: Indicates the operation of enrolling the video unit has failed because the SSL certificates has errors.

member.name: T:Genetec.Sdk.WeakEventManagers.INotifyEntityInvalidated
member.summary: Interface declaring an event for the EntitiesInvalidated events

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.WeakEventManagers.INotifyEntityInvalidated.EntityInvalidated
member.summary: Event fired when an entity has been invalidated.
member.remarks:
In order to migrate easily from this version to the new event the simple approach is the following:
1. Update your event handler to take the new event args type:
2. iterate over the property of the event args in a foreach loop and put all of the old code of the method into the loop
the Entities property iterates items of type which contain the same information as the previous event args had.
Of course this way of migrating your code does NOT take advantage of the fact that you now get a collection of invalidates. A more custom update that uses the batch to improve performance of your handler is highly recommended.

member.summary: Event called when one or more entities have been invalidated

member.name: E:Genetec.Sdk.WeakEventManagers.INotifyEntityRemoved.EntityRemoved
member.summary: Event fired when an entity has been removed.
member.remarks:
In order to migrate easily from this version to the new event the simple approach is the following:
1. Update your event handler to take the new event args type:
2. iterate over the property of the event args in a foreach loop and put all of the old code of the method into the loop
the Entities property iterates items of type which contain the same information as the previous event args had.
Of course this way of migrating your code does NOT take advantage of the fact that you now get a collection of updates. A more custom update that uses the batch to improve performance of your handler is highly recommended.
